parsed.internal_thinking: I have placed my first settlement on Node 43, which is a powerhouse for Wheat production, yielding from two 9s and one 6 (totaling 13 pips). However, my resource variety is non-existent, making a port or a diversified second settlement essential. Node 50 is a 3:1 port located just two road segments away (43-42, 42-50). Although Node 42 is blocked for a settlement due to Bob's placement at Node 41, I can still build a road through it. Reaching Node 50 not only provides the 3:1 port to leverage my Wheat surplus but also adds Ore 5 and another Wheat 9 to my production. The alternative paths (toward 44 or 33) offer some Ore or Sheep but don't provide the immediate strategic utility of a port. Therefore, building toward Node 42 is the most efficient way to secure my mid-game economy. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Priority 1: Secure the 3:1 port at Node 50 to trade my excess Wheat. Priority 2: In the second setup round, aim for Node 12 or 13 to gain Wood and Brick production. Bob has a strong hold on Ore, so I may need to negotiate trades with him once my Wheat engine is running.
parsed.say_outloud: I've placed my settlement on Node 43 to capitalize on that massive wheat production. Now, I'm heading towards the coast at Node 42 to hopefully secure a port early on. That 3:1 port at Node 50 looks like a vital lifeline for my strategy!
